title: Stop lowering Ult cds!
body: I am completely sick of this. Where is the option to outplay anyone when ult cds are dropping to under 30 seconds on average. I do not understand the point of this. People complain about "snowball," and it is not even that, it is this ult cd crap. Ult cds should never be under 60 seconds ever, they are powerful champ deleters in most cases and there should be opportunities to play around them. Penalties for using ults early or at the wrong time. Now there is not. Ults are just another regular ability and now champs like lux should be able to use 3 ults per teamfight.... I try not to think of Riot as trolls right now but it increasingly becomes tougher and tougher. This shit makes 0 sense.

replies.body: "hey he used his lvl 1 R like 40 secs ago, I think I should be able to.... nah he has it up again... anyway thats a silly death but now that I'm back to lane there is no way that he just ults aga.... fuck this game"

Basically if lux gets 2 kills/assists within 1.75 seconds after hitting them with her ult, the ult gets COMPLETELY refunded at lvl 3

Yeah as if it wasnt low enough already

But i guess one can use a 900 damage laser every 10 seconds

Edit: woops yeah it can only trigger once, my bad
but still with the new Presence of mind it can still get reduced fully with enough kills and max CDR

The cooldown refund on Lux's R can only trigger once, regardless of how many people she kills/nearly kills with it. 

I like playing Lux, but this plus the new Presence of Mind is a bit stupid. If she gets a penta with her third level ult, she will have it back up instantly.
She needs help, but not like this.
They just changed it so it can fully refund from just 2 kills max rank :/
can only trigger once per ult.
She doesn't even need a penta. If she has ult hat + presence of mind, all she needs is a triple and it'll be up again.

Ult hat doesn't work like that.  It reduces base cooldown which other sources of CDR then work on.  Also pretty sure Presence of Mind uses the CD after regular CDR is taken into account anyways.

For any champion other than Lux, an ace with full participation will refund 50% of their ult CD.  Lux is special in that her ult already has a similar effect, and these effects stack optimally, like regular CDR stacks with regular CDR.

It may still be a bit strong, in which case I'd suggest that Presence of Mind reduces the remaining CD by 10%, meaning that each proc in a row is worth less than the previous.  For instance if they happened instantly with your ult, the first proc would reduce the CD to 90% and then the second would reduce it to 81%.  This would also make it so if you're in the last 10% wait for your ult and you get a kill, it won't instantly refresh your ult.

Ult hat (without Cosmic Insight) and 40% CDR reduces Lux's ult CD to about 24 seconds at max rank.

Presence of Mind refunds 10% of ult cooldown per kill. This is not current cooldown, this is max cooldown. Very important to remember.

The way Lux's ult works is that it refunds 50% of its cooldown if it kills or one of its targets dies within 1.5 seconds. so that reduces the cooldown from 24 to 12. 30% of 24 is 7.2 seconds, leaving 4.8 seconds remaining. And yet I've managed to get full reset on three kills on several separate instances in a bots game.

I think that Presence of Mind ignores Ultimate Hat's cooldown reduction (since it's a unique effect and isn't tied to purchasing CDR). That would mean that from Presence of Mind's calculation, Final Spark would have a 35.7 second cooldown. 30% of this value is 10.7, leaving 1.3 seconds of cooldown after Presence of Mind and Final Spark's refund effect both trigger.

Since Final Spark goes onto cooldown as soon as you cast it, it has a second or two to tick down before the refunds are applied. Leaving it fully reset once both go through.

Of course this only holds if Presence of Mind refunds Max CD, but I'm fairly certain that's the case.
Fucking late game {{champion:23}}
Good tryndamere players only take the last two points of ult at 17 and 18 so its not up as much as youd think

{{champion:99}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:53}}  

Yup
Their ults aren't strong, which is why it has a low cooldown. They're just extra damage skills.
Did you just call lux and katarina ults not strong? I dont think that's true.

> Their ults aren't strong... They're just extra damage skills.

I'm not sure what you're getting at here, though the last time I played League of Legends, last night infact, me being nuked by a Lux R was either guaranteed death or so low that the next Poke skill from another enemy team member would finish me off. 

Lucky for me I also play {{champion:203}}  so I didn't die, but that's not the point.



Edit: More to the point, damage isn't as important as AoE CC, though that changes with the base damage and AP ratios of an Ult are absurd and up sub 30 seconds such as Lux. Then you've got the AoE silence from Blitzcrank that's up just as often, if not more often. Katarina has seen more Quadras and Pentas than any other champion I reckon. There's very little evidence to say that any of these 3 champions aren't Ult centric in their play-style even if they have a full kit of powerful positioning, mobility, and CC skills.
How much of a troll {{champion:163}} would be if she had 30 second cooldowns.
Shed still suck tbh
Yeah who the hell thought giving a champion the ability to use the most potent map obstacle in the game more often would make them more powerful. Here, take my upvote.
Not sure if sarcasm, but the delay on it is extremely significant and its range level 1 is terrible. Outside of certain scenarios all its good for is blowing flash

Removing a flash or three from the enemy team is significant, beyond that it also creates a barrier for other champions to use skills on such as Vayne. Taliyah can cut and entire lane in half, making marksmen get off several autos for free. Taliyah can also block objectives, even Rift Herald charge, from nuking a base turret. There's a lot of creative utility and at the very least it burns the most used, highest cooldown summoner spell.

For a long cd very telegraphed ult thats only useful in very fringe scenarios, it really just wouldnt be very good.

The problem is you either give them a get out of jail free card (flash) or you force your allies to blow flash to get the kill s well because the wall takes a while to go down.
If that was true, she wouldnt be played in half of pro games

A) she was picked 15 times in spring putting her right smack in the middle of average picks.

B) LCS =/= everything else.
The balance team is the chief problem.

I agree I believe the balance team is the worst team at riot, the rest of the teams have improved over the years where as the balance team has just fucked the game more.

I remember when they increased the CD of I believe garen's ult because ''it felt bad to die to his ult in lane and then when you returned it was up again so we're increasing the cooldown''

now it's low cd ults party

That was the justification for the old darius ult nerf where he got the full refund before level 16 I am pretty sure. Either that or the cooldown was so low that it didn't matter. Regardless I am pretty sure it was aimed at Darius over Garen iirc.

What about kassiden?

> [{quoted}](name=xSightlessx,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=0PWXmxjE,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2018-04-05T14:29:28.008+0000)
>

there are some champs like LeBlanc, Kassadin, Akali etc whose ultis are not as game changing as a Lux (Burst Aoe) or Sivir (team utility) ultis. There may be even better examples, overall Lux shouldn't become too strong
Wair now im confused. I thought lux's ult was a skill shot?
Its a skill shot but its still burst and AOE

Let me explain this to you as a Lux player. 
For one, as many have pointed out, her ult is dodgeable and the snare to be ulted is dodgeable.

Lux's kit's power requires that she uses ult. Without her ult, she pretty much just pokes relatively negligible damage(unless she's ahead) or you have awful positioning. So what happens if she misses her ult in a team fight? Then she waits for her ult to be up which means she's not contributing to fights much.
So what happens if you kill someone with her ult in a team fight? Then she still waits for her ult cd. The CD reduction is so that a Lux that _does her job_ can continue to be relevant in team fights. You can go "boohoo why does she get 2-3 ults in a fight," but for her to do so, she needs to be winning that fight AND other champions have abilities at their disposal to use without waiting on a CD. ADC can just auto and crit for "900" damage consistently throughout the team fight.

Lux's ult is pretty much her main damage in a rotation, the resets are just so she can keep doing her job if she's doing well.
The assist change was made because recently, due to shield, hexdrinker, supports, that one rune that's pretty much hexdrinker, Lux's ult doesn't always execute, even on a squishy. Now with this buff she gets the reset if the ult would have killed the enemy but your team is who gets the last hit.

Some ults are designed so that it's what a champion needs to finish an opponent. I mean that's how assassins work and their ult CD can be even lower or fully reset.

Just because her ultimate does the most damage doesn't mean it's her only use. That's like saying Vayne should get her ultimate reverted because she's at a 48% winrate right now and she can't fight assassins after a teamfight every time because she used her ultimate 20 seconds before. 

Are you kidding me?

Poke and CC are important parts of her kit. "Damage and damage and even more damage" shouldn't define if a champion is relevant in teamfights or not. Her ultimate is a global with enough power to delete 75% of a squishy's health and her E+Q enough to do 50-70% late game. 

If you say Lux is only relevant with her R, then you're a bad Lux. You have a shield, CC root snare for up to 2 targets, and an E you can all spam to do continuous rotations of damage. I don't want to hear she's irrelevant without her ultimate.

"But her ultimate is so easy to dodge without CC with mobility creep Elo"

Oh - really now? She needs a condition to land her ultimate most of the time and accuracy. Wow - I didn't know a burst, execute ultimate with the width of half the lane needed a condition to land most of the time.

Especially since her kit offers that CC through a snare/root with an AoE slow that also chunk you. Man, maybe Lux players just need to risk themselves in teamfights if they want to catch someone with their ultimate rather than spam it 1000 units away.

Did Lux need buffs? Yes but they overdid it.

2-3 ULTIMATES in a fight make absolutely no sense. Even Yasuo doesn't get 3 windwalls every teamfight often times. And at least Yasuo doesn't have burst ultimate late-game. He actually requires CC and his ultimate is less damage and more utility. (Gives passive buff+knockup)

"Oh, I missed my ultimate and I'm useless. Lux should be buffed because she's significantly less useful in teamfights now without hitting anyone."

That's your cost. You missed an important ability. 

Instead now, Lux can:

- Clear waves with her ultimate and get it back up again
- Randomly fire her ultimate simply to get enemies off of objectives and have it back up again
- Completely miss her ultimate, and have it back up again

Just because teamfight's are 10-30 seconds doesn't mean Lux's ultimate needs to be up every time.

Don't put words into my mouth. You're entire statement just reaffirms that the majority of Lux's damage is in her ult. You know damn well that a Lux isn't doing any damage when her R is not up and what you're saying makes no sense. Lux gets the refund assuming whatever she hit died. This is to reward the Lux for landing her shit on an enemy instead of clearing waves with it first. Also you keep bringing up late game, but this buff is mainly for early game.
You just sound like the kinda person who got deleted by some over fed Lux and want to act like she's over powered. Her winrate hasn't even gone up since this patch lol.

The "instead now Lux can:" makes no sense because the refund is just for if her ult is used to kill someone...Sorry but there's champions with low ult cooldowns. Why Lux's ult is low cd is fairly obvious.

I made a statement saying WHY Lux is getting this buff and why it really just helps Lux do what she already does. Nowhere did I say that CC and poke don't matter lmao

> Lux's kit's power requires that she uses ult. Without her ult, she pretty much just pokes relatively negligible damage(unless she's ahead) or you have awful positioning

> Don't put words into my mouth. You're entire statement just reaffirms that the majority of Lux's damage is in her ult.

I didn't. Your own post says it - literally. And my post doesn't reaffirm that. I literally gave evidence that she's still useful with the rest of her kit. 

> You just sound like the kinda person who got deleted by some over fed Lux and want to act like she's over powered. Her winrate hasn't even gone up since this patch lol.

Dude - skill-shaming isn't going to help you win this argument. We can easily op.gg each other.

> I made a statement saying WHY Lux is getting this buff and why it really just helps Lux do what she already does. Nowhere did I say that CC and poke don't matter lmao

But you state: 

>  You know damn well that a Lux isn't doing any damage when her R is not up and what you're saying makes no sense

And you state :

> Lux's kit's power requires that she uses ult. Without her ult, she pretty much just pokes relatively negligible damage

What I'm saying makes sense. You're just emotionally enraged. Literally, you're countering yourself. You just said you didn't say poke and her other abilities don't do anything and here you are saying they do nothing.

Notice how I am using quotes so I'm not "putting words in your mouth" this time.

Also, on your argument:

> Sorry but there's champions with low ult cooldowns. Why Lux's ult is low cd is fairly obvious.

List them. Let's see how many of them are as short as Lux's. 61.2% ult CD aggregate with sorcery+CDR alone and Lux's ult passive and you're telling me other champions have shorter CDs...
{{champion:34}}

>Her ultimate is a global with enough power to delete 75% of a squishy's health

.

>Lux
>Range: 3340
>Damage: 300/400/500+75% AP Magic Damage


"Global". Also, 500+75% AP is not gonna be 75% of a squishes HP any way you slice it. *Maybe* if you both assume True Damage and add a Ludens proc you can get in the ballpark, but we're talking literal full build there, and an adc with 0 MR when Merc Scimitar exists.


>Instead now, Lux can:

>Clear waves with her ultimate and get it back up again
>Randomly fire her ultimate simply to get enemies off of objectives and have it back up again
>Completely miss her ultimate, and have it back up again


Hate to break it to you, but this isn't a "now" thing, this has literally been the state of Lux Ult for the entirety of league history (it actually used to be lower). A low ult cd is one of Lux's iconic features. The current buffs don't do a damn thing to help in those circumstances you mentioned, and if she does that (especially before rank 3), she risks it not being up for a fight.
Pretty sure her ult also sets and ignites her passive.
That's definitely part of the power creep.

Randuins omen or frozen heart etc. now practically everything gives CDR and it's so easy to reach the cap without sacrificing damage or any stats.

Saying "just dodge it" is pretty crap. It's fairly wide and ridiculous range. It isn't that simple.

{{champion:223}}  still has one of the highest cds when you have a full cdr + ultimate hat + presence...does that mean tahm`s ult is gamechanging? He cant babysit the splitpusher and wait to ult them in because most of the time he is the only thing stopping the enemy team from engaging.....

Why are super crazy damaging / ccing group fight ults lower than his....
